about.bio: I am a Research and Development Software Engineer at ABB in the Process Automation Measurement & Analytics (PAMA) division, specializing in embedded systems for industrial automation. I have a solid background in full-stack software development and Embedded Systems, with expertise in Java, Spring Boot, React.js, Vue 3, C++, Python  and cloud technologies. Previously, I worked at Goldman Sachs as a Full-Stack Software Engineer, focusing on security remediation in the Treasury Settlement Application. I am currently pursuing a Master's in Computer Science to further enhance my skills in software development, IoT, and cloud solutions.
about.tagline: Innovating industrial automation with software engineering.

work.responsibilities: Developing software solutions for industrial automation, working with cloud technologies, Java, and machine learning.
Focused on security remediation for the Treasury Settlement Application, developing both front-end and back-end components.

responsibilities: Led key software development projects that enhanced system efficiencies and client trust through innovative technological solutions.

Spearheaded the development of the automated new customer connection management system using Angular and Spring Boot, enabling real-time job assignments, meter allocation, and data submission for field technicians enhancing operational efficiency and customer satisfaction.

Utilized MuleSoft, RESTful APIs and Java Spring Boot in designing UMEME's CRM system integration to automate meter setup, reducing vending initiation time from 26 hours to under a minute, optimizing workforce allocation, and cutting costs.

Designed and maintained robust database systems with MySQL and Cassandra, optimizing performance and management through advanced indexing and tailored stored procedures, resulting in a 20% enhancement in query execution times.
Led the pilot project for an automated power theft detection system utilizing machine learning, Apache Kafka, Apache Spark, and Power BI, which improved fraud detection accuracy from 10% to 40%.

Spearheaded UMEME's meter reading digitization, employing React and Spring Boot with geofencing and mobile imaging, cutting the cycle from five to two days, enhancing efficiency, customer trust, and cash flow.
Spearheaded SCADA and load monitoring unit development, improving electricity distribution efficiency.
Engineered and coded firmware for IoT-enabled Load Monitoring Units using C++ and CodeWarrior IDE, leading to the deployment of over 200 units across Uganda and India.
Pioneered the development of the LuminGo SCADA system using NodeRed, ReactJS, Firebase, AWS, and IBM Cloud, enhancing data processing and visualization speeds by 25% for Load Management Units.

Led the front-end development, focusing on creating intuitive user interfaces and ensuring a responsive design with React.js, aligned with RESTful services and secure cloud deployment using the Spring Framework.

projects.title: Resort Management System (RMS)
projects.description: This system facilitated online reservations and payments for resort accommodations, incorporating RESTful microservices and Spring technologies. Involved in domain-driven design for UML class diagrams, architectural planning for a scalable and secure system, and implementing security features like Spring Security with JWT.

projects.title: Library Management System
projects.description: A Swing-based desktop application designed to manage library functionalities such as book cataloging, user account management, and the borrowing process. Developed a user-friendly interface and implemented CRUD operations for Books and Users.

projects.title: Low Voltage Circuit Breaker Remote Closing System Using GSM
projects.description: Designed and implemented a remote closing system for low voltage circuit breakers using GSM, enhancing efficiency by reducing manual interventions for fault recovery. The system includes automated fault detection, reclosure attempts, and SMS alerts for permanent faults.
